channel.title: About time MITB hosts
channel.description:
How could the community trust a normal user to host an official server? MITB has the resources available, and he's the owner of the site.
MITB should host it.

item.title: About time MITB hosts
item.dc:creator: @Canownueazy Canownueazy
item.description:
@Canownueazy wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:14, topic:376748”]There are quite a few things you can do to reduce the lag you guys are getting, because like people are say, some people have no lag, while others have a lot. First thing you can do is change your render distance. Hit esc, then go to options. Depending on your computer, you may need to set it on ‘Tiny’ to get no lag.

It can also be your connection, which I can’t fix. One thing you can do is go to speedtest.net, and change the server. Find my state (Washington, USA; in the North West of the country) and start the test. My down/up speeds vary by distance etc, but it seems fine for most people. lalagggg

Also, remember: Connection lag is not fps lag. I have experienced connection lag. It goes something like this: You place a block, after about two seconds, the block disappears. Then after a few more seconds (depending on your lag) it will reappear.

If you do get connection lag, like the example above, that’s when there is a problem with our connections.[/quote] Failure.

When I do New York I get 20mbps

Read full topic

item.title: About time MITB hosts
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:14, topic:376748”]There are quite a few things you can do to reduce the lag you guys are getting, because like people are say, some people have no lag, while others have a lot. First thing you can do is change your render distance. Hit esc, then go to options. Depending on your computer, you may need to set it on ‘Tiny’ to get no lag.

It can also be your connection, which I can’t fix. One thing you can do is go to speedtest.net, and change the server. Find my state (Washington, USA; in the North West of the country) and start the test. My down/up speeds vary by distance etc, but it seems fine for most people. lalagggg

Also, remember: Connection lag is not fps lag. I have experienced connection lag. It goes something like this: You place a block, after about two seconds, the block disappears. Then after a few more seconds (depending on your lag) it will reappear.

If you do get connection lag, like the example above, that’s when there is a problem with our connections.[/quote]

You can just push F to change your render distance.

Read full topic

item.title: About time MITB hosts
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

erm wouldn’t a server of that magnitude with more players than say a normal private minecraft server have a toll on the bandwidth, plus this is an rsps community, it’s turning into a minecraft community. If anything we need official moparscape rsps. Anyhow there should be a concern about bandwidth usage.

Read full topic

item.title: About time MITB hosts
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

There are quite a few things you can do to reduce the lag you guys are getting, because like people are say, some people have no lag, while others have a lot. First thing you can do is change your render distance. Hit esc, then go to options. Depending on your computer, you may need to set it on ‘Tiny’ to get no lag.

It can also be your connection, which I can’t fix. One thing you can do is go to speedtest.net, and change the server. Find my state (Washington, USA; in the North West of the country) and start the test. My down/up speeds vary by distance etc, but it seems fine for most people. lalagggg

Also, remember: Connection lag is not fps lag. I have experienced connection lag. It goes something like this: You place a block, after about two seconds, the block disappears. Then after a few more seconds (depending on your lag) it will reappear.

If you do get connection lag, like the example above, that’s when there is a problem with our connections.

Read full topic

item.title: About time MITB hosts
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

There is settings you can change to reduce lag for yourself. I tweeked with some settings and downloaded a HD pack, and I don’t seem to have lag when others complain about non stop lag.

Read full topic

item.title: About time MITB hosts
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I do lagg at night for some reason, I’ve started lagging a bit more than usual. I never used to get lagg.

item.title: About time MITB hosts
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’m going to physically host it, but davidi is still going to administrate it. I’d say the lag is due to his slow connection, but that’s not really his fault.

Read full topic

item.title: About time MITB hosts

Yes but not because I don’t trust David, just that I think it would be better because of less uptime.

item.title: About time MITB hosts
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=472675.msg3457390#msg3457390 date=1294145473]

[s][b]Rule 2: Advertising your own Minecraft server is most definitely not accepted here[/b] - find your own unique way to gain a player base.[/s] Until we have some sort of server status list I am removing this rule as several complaints have been made on the subject.

Read full topic

item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

I think it’s fine the way it is, but it never hurts to upgrade now in case the server get’s to big for David’s computer to handle it. Although enough with the “This lag is David’s fault” because that’s just not true.
